result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G Guevara-Salamanca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert G Guevara-Salamanca

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert G Guevara-Salamanca appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Robert G Guevara-Salamanca.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Alberto Aguilar.
Case in court for a status conference.  Parties held negotiations off the record.  
On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Retail Theft, Co. Ord. 63.043 to which defendant pled no contest.
Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including all costs and surcharges by 11/17/22. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Robert G Guevara-Salamanca in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Robert G Guevara-Salamanca.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Scheduling conference held.  Interpreter waived by the defense.  Atty De Leon would like her client to consult with an immigration attorney and requests a status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert G Guevara-Salamanca in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Robert G Guevara-Salamanca.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. 
Court order signature bond to continue.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Robert G Guevara-Salamanca not in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Robert G Guevara-Salamanca in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Attorney waived interpreter for today's hearing. SPD will be reappointing a spanish speaking attorney. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with All IKEA stores.

Defendant Robert G Guevara-Salamanca in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Liesl Monroy
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-5-2022 @1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07/05/2022@1pm
